13532222112.title: Or Wait You not Brony Or Shocked

choices: Try and get the costume off
135322221121.content:
"Gah!" you shout in Luna's voice, quickly putting a hoof over your mouth in surprise. "Why did I... change?!" You try to stand but your rear hooves can't balance like your feet could and you shakily settle back onto all four. "B-but I was just trying this on... I don't want to be a pony!" You lift your forehooves to the sky melodramatically, tossing your head back.

No one seems to hear your outburst, despite your copious use of the Royal Canterlot Voice, so you calm down after a while and sit there thinking.
135322221121.title: Shocked

choices: Try to use magic to get the zipper
Risk it, and go to the party
1353222211211.content:
'Ok...' You think to yourself, 'If I get the coustume off, I should be able to change back.' You then reach your hoof to your back, to try and get the zipper. But you come across a little problem; Hooves. They couldn't grasp anything, so they couldn't grasp the zipper! You desperately try to get the zipper, to get out of this coustume. You then look at the clock, there was only 10 minutes left until the party!

'Great!' You think, 'it's either get this off and be late, or go to the party and be humiliated!
1353222211211.title: Try and get the costume off

1353222211212.content: 'Ok,' you think to yourself, not wanting to hear your new voice, 'So I'm now Luna. It could be worse...' You think giving your new body a look. You gave your arm a poke, and you felt it as if it was your skin, since it very well was. You look on your back. To see the zipper barely visible. You would figure that out later though.
1353222211212.title: Give Luna a chance

1353222212.content: If not Princess Luna, then surely Derpy Hooves?
1353222212.title: Somepony Else

13532222121.content:
You find a dorky looking quadrupedal suit fashioned after Derpy Hooves, the grey, blonde, cross eyed Pegasus from Friendship is Magic. You think briefly of how silly you'd look in it but find yourself still wanting to try it on. So you sneak off to a changing room with the suit and get your arms and legs in place, zip the back up and then pull the head over your own.
Observing the full length mirror, you can't help but laugh a little bit. "I'm wearing a flippin pony costume." you think, "This is bizarre, it doesn't really even fit me."
At this point you've sunk to all fours to get the full effect. "Hmm, not bad! This thing actually looks okay like this." you say aloud. "No way would I ever wear it in public though!" you finish, emphasizing your thoughts by extending your wings.

...

Wait, 'your wings'?
13532222121.title: Derpy

135322221211.content:
"Oh my gosh!" you cry, "I can move my wings!" You grin ecstatically across your grey pony muzzle and flutter your wings briefly. "I wonder if I can fly?" you ask yourself, and before you know it you've managed to get several inches off the ground, flapping your wings and taking care not to bump into the mirror. Unfortunately you haven't quite gotten used to your eyes looking different directions and you soon smash into the dressing room door. "Ouchie!" you say from a heap on the floor, rubbing your injured muzzle with a hoof. "I just... dunno what went wrong..."

After a couple test runs you've unlocked the door to the dressing room with your forehooves and you're on your way to the counter. Nopony- er, nobody else is particularly surprised at you if they notice anything, likely due to the nature of the shop. You reach the register and fly up to head level with the cashier. "Hi! I want to pay for uh, the costume I'm wearing." you pause pensively. "Dunno how I'll reach my wallet though."

"Don't worry." He replies. "You can have that one on the house, since you seem to like it so much. Just be sure and tell anyone who asks where you got it." he says with a wink and a knowing smile.

You grin and give him a quick midflight hug over the counter. "Thank you!" you say as you make for the exit.

"Don't forget- the costume'll go permanent if you wear it for more than 24 hours straight!" he calls after you. You're not even sure you'd mind that much; flying is really fun.
135322221211.title: Woohoo!

choices: Go back to the store to get Lance a costume
1353222212112.content:
You fly higher and higher outside, cresting over rooftops and instinctively noticing thermals. Your derpy bi-directional eyes are starting to actually help you see more rather than crash more. As you fly, you haven't forgotten the reason you visited the shop to begin with- to go to your friend's costume party birthday. In fact, as you ponder this you're already nearing his house. You swoop down for a smooth landing...

On the top floor of the spacious two-story house your friend's parents had thoughtlessly abandoned for the weekend, a group of guys and girls in a variety of odd costumes were having a great time, buzzed off of liquors and dancing energetically to a selection of electronica music. None of them, however, were watching out the window.

CRASH

You roll head-first multiple times across the dance floor before finally skidding to a stop wedged between the bar and the floor. Revelers present had the presence of mind to flee your path rather than be plowed into by whatever had come through the window. You're in a bit of pain and a little more shame so you wait a moment before trying to stand up.

A relative hush pervades the area. It's broken by footsteps ascending the staircase from the ground floor. "Guys! You better not have broken something important..." your friend, Lance, says with a hint of a slur as he pushes his way into the room. When he catches sight of you he stops. "A... pony?" He rubs his temple with one hand. "Oh god- I'm on drugs, aren't I?"

"Nah, Lance." You answer. "It's just me. Sorry bout the window."

"Just you? B...but you're a pony, though!" he snickers. "Don't go telling me that's your costume!"

"Ehh, okay. I won't tell you about how it is my costume." You smile sardonically at him, or try. You're a pony.

"Woah. That's an awesome costume then. If you like ponies, I mean." Lance amends.
1353222212112.title: Go To The Party

13532222121121.content:
You trot your way over to the impromptu bar, and Lance follows you over.
"Thassa good costume, mate." He repeats, breath colored with liquor. "I might be a bit tipsy but it looks really realistic."
"Ha!" you laugh nervously. "Yeah, I guess it does." You waste a couple seconds trying to grip a barstool with your hooves before remembering you can fly.
Lance doesn't seem to notice anything out of the ordinary.
You orient your Pegasus body on the seat comfortably, ending up in a bit of an awkward slouch, like Lyra Heartstrings. Ponies really ought not sit like this, but you don't seem to feel any problems with it.
Lance grabs a can of cider and slings a glass your way along the stained varnish of the bar top. You only just catch it (in your teeth) - to Lance's amusement.
"Dunno if you'll be needing any of this stuff tonight!" he jokes.
You laugh along with him briefly. "It's just these darn hooves!" you complain, still in Derpy's voice. "I mean, uh, costume."
Lance carries right on laughing as he pours you a drink. "Hahaha, whatever you say, mate."
13532222121121.title: Driven to Drink

135322221211211.content:
You manage to lift your glass with your forehooves, and you close your eyes and lean back on your barstool as you proceed drain the alcoholic contents in one long gulp. You grin at the ceiling as you absorb the pleasant burning sensation of the cider making its way through your pegasus body. The stool begins to tip now you've let go of the bar, but you manage to stabilize yourself at the last minute with a few beats of your wings. Finally setting the glass back down, you look back to your friend.

Lance is still only halfway through his first glass... although you suspect he had a lot more to drink before you arrived. You and Lance are usually apt to go through quite a bit of cider before you get properly buzzed.

...Actually, you're sort of starting to feel it already. (Hm, maybe Derpy doesn't drink much.)

Coming back to the present, you giggle and put a foreleg around your buddy's shoulders. "Lance, thish party's totally awesome!" you say with conviction.

Lance laughs raucously, a couple empty cans piled up before him. "Thanks bro!" He grins and opens another can. "You know they always are."

"Alwaysh are, dude!" you reply, raising your hoof in boisterous excitement.
135322221211211.title: Cider!

1353222212112111.content:
You prod Lance with a hoof.

"What?" he says.

"Pour me another glass!" you reply.

When he hands you your next glass you can't help but squee in joy, still feeling warm and lovely from your first. You savor the taste of the cider this time; no matter how cheap it was, right now you felt like it could have been a close friend. You smile contentedly as your glass finally runs dry, an ice cube tickling your muzzle. You lower the glass, slowly at first... and then your hoof betrays you and it ends up on its side. "Oops!" you yelp. "Eh, at least it was empty." you say, shrugging it off.

You turn your head to find that Lance had thoughtfully gotten you a fresh glass while you were preoccupied with your little slip-up. You grin sheepishly, blushing from the cider, and pull it over to yourself.
1353222212112111.title: More cider!

choices: You've woken up in time to take it off, should you choose.
13532222121121111.content:
And that's the last thing you remember.

You open your eyes the next day to see a very unwelcome dawn. It stings your irises and plays havoc with your hangover. "Guhhhh." you say in Derpy's voice. You suddenly clap your hooves over your mouth. You're still a pegasus! And you can't remember most of last night... you wonder how long you've been like this..!
13532222121121111.title: Black out

135322221211211111.content:
You frantically scrabble around on your coat, looking for the zipper pull. You turn your freshly-awake head about to examine your body. Nothing.
You're stuck as Derpy unless you get a new costume. Your bright yellow eyes wander over your grey fur, and your furled wings, soaking it in. This is you, you suppose. Not so bad. You can fly now.
You're also a mare. You're not sure how you feel about that, given ponies are rather different than you're used to to begin with. You guess you'll figure it out soon enough.
135322221211211111.title: Derp Forever

1353222212112111111.content:
You nestle your muzzle comfortably between the feathers of your right wing and the upholstery of the sofa you found yourself on. You don't feel ready to wake up yet, so you get nice and cozy in your fur and calm down enough to start drifting off. Finally, sleep takes you. You feel the pain of your hangover distance itself until you forget all about it. You're not even thinking anything at all, now.
Just resting...
1353222212112111111.title: Sleep

1353222212112111112.content:
The revelation does wonders for waking you up. Feeling sobered (and a little bit excited), you carefully maneuver your rear legs over the edge of the sofa you apparently crashed out on last night. With the help of a few rough flaps of your wings, you slide over the edge and land lightly on all four hooves. You trot around the pace, taking note of the few others who also passed out. You shake your head softy, wondering why you had to go and drink yourself into this situation. Mostly, you're just disappointed you didn't choose this consciously.

The party's long over, though. It's time to head elsewhere.
1353222212112111112.title: Head off

choices: Work to get this thing off!

You find yourself looking at a rack of little pony costumes. There are all sorts here; unicorns, pegasi, plain earth ponies... Aha! Your eye is caught by a glimpse of soft pink fur and messy fuschia mane. You know that you just gotta try the Pinkie Pie costume.
After all, it IS a costume party.

You scarper off to the dressing room with your hot pink prize. Quickly working your arms and legs into the hooves of the costume, you share a brief look with yourself in the mirror. You're whimsically trying on a pink pony costume; you really are fit to be Pinkie.

After zipping up the head over your own your vision is suddenly clouded. Blinking fervently, you're rewarded with the expected return of your eyesight. And a fine view of Pinkie Pie blinking in time with you in the mirror.

Huh, the eyes look really real. And they're moving when I look around. You twitch an ear at the puzzling reality of the costume, and nervously swish your poofy cotton-candy tail side to side. "It's probably nothing." you say to yourself in Pinkie's chirpy voice.

You trotted around the isles for a bit, wondering how this coustume could be so realistic! The air conditioned room made you feel colder than expected for a coustume, and it even made your voice sound like the classic character! You find a mirror again, and stare at the coustume you were in. Everything felt too... Real. To get a better view of the coustume, you try to stand up on two legs, but for some reason, you can't! You stagger back onto all fours, leaving you to stare. You open your mout wide, to feel the separation from you and the coustume, but it feels like a mouth! Not a coustume! You've BECOME Pinkie! You quickly rush to the clerk.

"Um, excuse me," you say, inwardly gagging at Pinkie's voice coming out of your mouth, "But I appear to have become the coustume I was wearing." You say, trying to be as un-awkward as possible. The clerk chuckles.

"That's what makes these coustumes so special sir, or as I should call you, miss. You put them on, you BECOME the coustume. It becomes permenant after 24 hours." He informs, "And with those hooves you've got there, it'll be a challenge to get it off." He mocks, waving his fingers. You quickly rush back into the changing room, but not before he calls out, "And when the 24 hours is up, you become the character, MENTALLY."

First, you noticed that the costume's feet were flat hooves, similar to what the ponies have in the show. But slowly looking up from the hooves, you noticed how there was padding within the legs, making the legs look more anthropomorphic than human. Then, you noticed the curves on the Anthro Twilight costume, as they were slightly more voluptuous than the average female model, possibly to accommodate the anthropomorphic features. Then, you noticed the the dark purple & pink pony tail Twilight had, as it was positioned just above the costume's perky & furry butt cheeks.

However, looking up toward the costume's upper body, you noticed that the Anthro Twilight costume had a pair of perky Double-D Cup breasts, along with a set of humanoid arms covered in short light purple fur, as each arm had a hand with four fingers and a thumb. But like the arms, most of the costume was coated with short light purple fur.

Finally, as you looked at the costume's head, you couldn't help but notice how the costume's mane felt so life-like, letting your free hand gently glide along the dark purple waist-length hair, along with showing off that pink stream of hair in the costume's mane. However, since Twilight was a unicorn, you instantly noticed the spiralling horn sticking out from the mane's bangs, along with the mask's snout, making the costume feel more akin to a fursuit, not to mention the light purple equine ears poking out from the upper sides of the costume's head. Although, there were a set of transparent purple eyes that are used for seeing when wearing the costume.

141.content:
While walking down the fantasy section in the store, you come across a display full of dragon costumes. Dragons have always been something you liked, so you decide to look at these more thoroughly. You eventually come across one that catches your eye. On the outside, it shows the image of a powerful looking two-headed dragon. One side of it is a brilliant shade of red. The other side is a bright shade of cyan. The writing on the outside said that this costume was for two people. You figure that since you were heading over to your friend's house, he wouldn't mind trying out this awesome costume.

You grab onto the box, and take it to the front desk. The old man sees you coming, and smiles. "I see from your expression that you found one you like." It takes a closer look at the box and his smile turns almost devious looking. "Awww...yes the two-headed dragon costume. A very interesting choice. May I ask who will be joining you in the costume."

You hand the man the box as you respond. "Just a friend of mine. He is into dragons as much as I am, so it should be fun!"

"Well, I can assure you that you and your friend will become much closer." The man laughed. Suddenly, his expression turned serious. "Before you go and buy this though, I have to warn you about my policy." You look at him funny. "Oh, its nothing to worry about really. I just want to let you know that all sales are final. So, no refunds or exchanges!"

"Okay! I won't want to return it anyways." You smile at him.

"Good, good. So...the total comes out to be $10.00." The man smiles again.

"Only 10 bucks. Wow, that's a steal." You excitedly hand him the money. He hands you your costume, and you quickly leave. You can barely hold in your excitement as you approach your friend's house.
141.title: A dragon costume for two

choices: You and Jake are now the two-headed dragon, and you were in Jake's house

1411.content:
You knock on the door, and your best friend answers. "Zack! What took you so long?" Your friend motions for you to enter, and closes the door behind you. You quickly lead the way to his room before you explain what you had brought.

"Check it out, Jake!" You excitedly hold up the costume box. "I picked this up at a new costume shop down the street. I know how much you wanted to dress up like a dragon for next Halloween, so I bought this for the two of us."

Jake's face light up. "This is awesome Zack! You want to try it out?"

"Don't have to ask me twice." You and Jake excitedly open up the box and pull out the costume. It looked even cooler then the picture; the scales really popped out in the light. It almost looked real.

After a brief argument about which head you would each take, you agreed to take the blazing red head, and Jake took the dazzling blue head. Fitting your bodies into the costume wasn't an easy task. Finally, you manged to make it work. You put your right hand into the right claw of the costume, and your friend did the same with the left claw. Your remaining arms were wrapped around each other's shoulders for balance. Each of your feet were placed into the two legs of the costume. You then helped each other put the masks on.

"Wow! This is a nice costume." You and Jake were admiring the costume in his mirror.

"Hold on, we forgot to zip up the back." You quickly reach over, and pull the zipper up. As soon as it was zipped shut, a bright light suddenly surrounded you.

14111.content:
When the light faded, black spots clouded your vision. You blinked several times trying to get it back, but that wasn't working to well. Other than your vision, you notice something is very wrong. Your body feels...wrong. Your head feels heavier, and your neck, its like its been stretched out. Also, your body is bulky and hard. It feels like you have something on your back. Your butt feels weird too; its almost like you have a tail. Your right arm and leg feel huge and powerful...Wait a second! you thought. I can't feel my left side. From the left side of your neck down, your feeling just disappears.

A little scared, you call out, "Jake, are you there?" Funny, you thought, Is my voice really that deep.

Directly to the left of you, Jake answers, "Y-yeah...I'm here...kind of...um...I think...we...might have a...slight problem with the costume."

Wow! you thought, When did Jake's voice crack? The spots in your vision finally faded, and you could see things clearly. You turn your head over toward your friend. You are more than shocked to see the cyan colored dragon head in his place. It moved and blinked. Its mouth opened as it breathed, allowing you to see a layer of dagger sharp teethe inside. The light bounced off its scales, making it look very impressive...and powerful. But, you could see...your friend through its eyes. The cyan dragon was your friend, and he had a very worried look on his face. "Jake..." you breathe. "What happened to you? Y-your the dragon from the costume!"

"Um...Zack...I think you mean we're the dragon from the costume." Jake timidly said. Jake motioned with his head toward the mirror, in front of you.

You gaze into the mirror; your eyes widen and your mouth drops. Instead of seeing your human head, you see the same red dragon from the costume. Only, the red dragon, or you, look so much more...dazzling than the costume. Even with the shocked look on your face. Once the shock wore off, you smiled at your reflection. You say in your head, Maybe this isn't so bad. Jake and I used to always imagine being dragons. Not having to go to school would be a plus. Finally it dawns on you. Wait a second, Jake said 'we're the dragon from the costume.' The dragon from the costume was...

Horrified upon the realization, you glance down at your body...or actually, yours and Jake's body. At the base of your neck, your two different colored scales collide. Directly to the left of your neck is Jake's neck. You slowly shift your gaze back to Jake. His face horrified face matches yours. Jake clears his throat, and then whispers, "Where did you get the costume?"
14111.title: Zack and Jake the two-headed dragon

choices: bang on the door till he opens it
141112.content:
"From the new costume store down the street.", you say. "We have to go back and have them get this costume off, Zack. I don't want to be a dragon forever." "But we can't go down stairs, your mom would freak out if she saw a two-headed dragon." Jake looks around for a bit and finally says, " We can sneak out the window"

"But how are we going to walk?", you say quietly, hoping Jake's mom won't hear. "We'll just have to go slowly, one step at a time." He lifts up his foot, slowly, and then moves it forward, putting back on the ground. You do the same, almost losing your balance. After a few minutes, you and Jake are at the window.

"Are we going to fly, or something?", he says. " i don't know, just like our legs, only one of us control a certain wing."
Looking disappointed, Jake slowly opens up the window. "So are we going to jump?", he says. You realize trying to fly would be smarter than jumping. You sigh,"Fine,", you say,"We can try flying."

You and Jake start to climb out the window. "Ready?" you say. Jake nods. You close your eyes and you and Jake push off. You frantically flap your wing, hoping Jake does the same. You open your eyes and see that you and Jake are flying! once you get to the costume shop, you bang on the door. The man opens it up, "What do you want?" , he says in a low and annoyed voice. "We need you to help us get this costume off." He stares at you and finally says, "No refunds!"
141112.title: You and Jake try sneaking out of the house

1411121.content:
He slams the door in your faces. "What, no refunds!" Jake yells. "We don't want a refund, we just want to get out of the costume." After a few moments, the man still did not open the door. "Open up!" Jake yells as he uses his front claw to pond on the door. Without meaning to, he punches a hole in it. "Oops"

This time, the man opens the door. He looks down at us with fire in his eyes. "Leave!"

You glare at him. "Not until you fix the costume! We didn't want to be a dragon, let alone a two-headed dragon."

"I can't help you. There is no way to take it off because the two of you now are the costume. Your old bodies are no more; this is your new body. I thought I explained that to you."

"NO!" you yell. "You only said there was no... uh... no..."

The man sighed, "No refunds or exchanges. In other words, you can not take it off or change to a different costume. I thought I made that clear... apparently not." The man then returned to his glare, "Now Leave!" He shoot the door in their faces again, but this time a faint yellow wall appeared, blocking them.

You and Jake look at each other, not knowing what to do now.
1411121.title: You and Jake are persistent

14111212.content:
"Ok, that's it," Jake says, "I give up. We'll have to be a two-headed dragon for the rest of our lives."
He looks down at the ground and kicks a pebble, sadness in his eyes. I'm sure if dragons could cry, he'd be crying.
So i tried to cheer him up, "It's not so bad, i mean... I thought you always wanted to be a dragon?"
"Yeah, but-"
"SSH!" i say, "I think i hear someone coming! Hide!"

We jump into the bushes as a woman passes by. I start to think that me and Jake are going to have a closer "bonding".
14111212.title: Jake gives up

141112121.content:
Once the woman is a safe distance away, we come out from behind the bushes. Jake still looked upset. I lifting his spirits a little,"C'mon Jake, once you give it some thought the idea of being half of a two-headed dragon isn't so bad."

"How can this not be bad... We have to work together to do something as simple as walking. We have to hide whenever people get near. We will... never be able see our families again. Zack, this is bad." Jake insisted. Jake let his side of their body slump, forcing them to lay down. He moved his head as far away from Zack's as he could. Which wasn't all that far.

"Of course it seems horrible if you only look at he negatives. You have to look at the positives too Jake." Jake turned his head to listen better. "I mean... we don't have to go to school now. We can eat, sleep, and poop whenever and wherever we want. We don't have to hide all the time people get near. It might be fun to give a few scares now and then."

Jake laughed at that. "Yeah"

"And" I continue, "now that we're are stuck with each other, we will never get lonely. We will always be there for each other. We may get on each other's nerves sometimes, but hey... thats what brothers are for."

"Brothers?" Jake gave me a funny look.

"Well... since we're sharing a body... I think that makes us brothers." I say.

Jake smiled, "Yeah, brothers.... Thanks for making me feel better Zack."

"No problem." I say.

"Well bro, I don't know about you, but I am tired. I think its time we find a spot to sleep for the night." Jake says.

I yawn. "Okay, sounds like a plan."
141112121.title: Zack comforts Jake

1411121212.content:
Marie, one of my other friends, walks by the costume shop.
"Hi Marie." i said. She immediately recognizes my voice.
"Wow, Zack, is that really you?" she said in surprise.
"And Jake." i say.
"Whoa, what happened?"

I explained to her how i bought the costume at the costume store behind us, and how when we put it on, we both turned into a two-headed dragon. I also told her about how we had to fly here and how the man said we couldn't change back.
"Wow, that must suck." She said, referring to the part where we couldn't change back.
"Hey, guys, where'd you say this costume shop was again?"
"Uh, right behind us, why-"
"Be right back." she interrupted. And she ran into the costume shop. Two minutes later, she runs out with a similar box to the one i had when i got my costume.
"What's in the box?" i asked.
"You'll see, just meet me at my house, o.k.?"
"O.k." you and Jake both say in unison.

About ten minutes of flying later, you and Jake are at Marie's house. You fly into the window of Marie's room. Marie is sitting on the bed.
"There you guys are! Phew, i thought you'd never get here!" Marie says. "O.k., look at what i bought." Marie hold up a silver dragon costume. The scales shone in my eyes when a ray of the sun fell on them.
"That's cool, but why'd you buy it?" Jake said.
"Because i want to be a dragon like you guys, now, how do i put this on?" after a few minutes of struggling with the costume, Marie finally gets it on.
"Now what?" she said.
"You just have to zip up the costume." I say. Jake and I help Marie zip up the costume. Once zipped up all the way, a blinding light fills the whole room. Once the light is gone, I see a beautiful, feminine, silver dragon standing where Marie had been a second ago.
"Now what?" Marie says.
1411121212.title: Marie comes

"Uh..." Zack and Jake looked at each other confused. "Well..." Jake continued, "I guess you should practice flying."

The light subdued, but something felt off. You felt heavier, your body less familiar. You saw a giant, scaly, red muzzle in front of your vision. Your neck was a lot longer and more flexible than before, for some reason you find it impossible to move your feet and decide to try and take a look, as you felt something long and thick swinging around just above your butt. You were surprised to find your neck respond, as it bended around. After getting rid of the nauseous feeling of having swung your head to fast, you see a large reptile like body, with big, yet nimble looking front and hind legs. Everything to seemingly the middle of your body was colored red, while the other half was colored blue, you felt the legs at the other side, but found them not responding to your commands. Then you felt something move next to your neck, as you felt it pulling and putting on its weight on your shoulders. Turning your head back to its original in front position, you try to look to the other side. Slowly you manage to get the hang of moving your neck and was astonished to discover a second head next to your own, this one colored blue.

“J…Jake, is that you?” You asked, as you saw the other head had taken notice of you.

“Zack, don’t freak out, but I think we became the dragon from the costume.” Jake answered, seemingly also worried.

After that confirmation, you take a look around and saw you were standing on a rocky hill and a weird looking town not so far away and somehow you could even see the people, all dressed in the oldest clothes you had ever seen, scuffling around.

“Zack, I don’t think we’re home anymore.” Jake said, as he to noticed the strange town and people.

“You can say that again.” You remarked back.

Nothing happens until you take it off
14121.content:
You finally decided that you didn't want to wait a whole hour for your girlfriend to stop by. You had such a child-like excitement and urge to try on the costume that it might boil over. It was like being a kid again, impatiently waiting to open your presents on birthdays. "If Jake wasn't doing his homework, we would have already tried it on by now. Geeze!!!!" You exclaim in frustration. "Fine..." You say to yourself, conceding to your impatients. "DAMION! Come here, I want to try something with you!"

Just a few moments later, you can hear footsteps as your younger brother, Damion, scrambles up the stairs. He walks in through your open doorway, "What is it Zack? I'm in the middle of watching something."

"That can wait. I want you to try this costume on with me." You hold up the two masks of the dragon costume, just now admiring how incredibly life-like the masks look and feel. Throwing Damion the ocean blue dragon mask you say, "Jack and I were going to try it out, but he bailed. Something about having to finish his homework because his parants were on him for his poor grades. So... your all I have to try it."

Damion catches the mask and runs the fabric through his hands. "Why me? Just try it on yourself."

"I would... but this is a two-person costume." You pull out the rest of the dragon costume from the large box; it was a lot bigger than you thought. "Your the only other person I have to try it, unfortunately."

Damion gazed at it, a smile spreading over his face. Despite obviously being enticed about how life-like it was he quickly tried to hide it with a frown. "Well, your way of asking doesn't really want to make help you. Besides, it looks big enough to fit four of us."

"Please Damion!" You pleaded.

He slowly rubbed his chin, as if still thinking about it; you already knew the answer before he said it. "Fine. But you owe me."

"Alright. Now lets get this thing on." You quickly say, already fitting your fiery red dragon mask on.

Fitting your bodies into the costume wasn't an easy task but you manged to make it work. You put your right hand into the right sleeve of the costume, and your friend did the same with the left sleeve. You each wrapped your remaining left and right arms respectively around each other's shoulders for balance. The pant legs were big enough to fit each of your feet so walking wasn't a problem.

Now standing infront of your shared bathroom's mirror, both you and Damion admire how well the costume actually looks. "Look it fits us fine, even though your a foot shorter then me."

Damion gave you a soft sock in the stomach, "Whatever. But I do have to hand it to you; it does look pretty awesome." Damion leaned a little closer to the mirror, noticing something wrong with the costume. "Hold on, the wings seem off. They're all saggy." He reached back, trying to fix them when he grazed past the zipper. "We forgot to zip it up all the way, hold on."

There are two races of Elves that enter the tales of Middle-Earth.

The Ñoldor, the Deep-elves, the people of Finwë. These are the Elves who left the Undying Lands, and it is this group that became the most prominent in the tales of the ensuing Ages.

Which of these will you join?

142322.content:
This odd little costume catches your eye. The thing was child sized, yet carried the label of adult. However, aside from that oddity it was otherwise a very by the book christmas elf. Red shoes with a bell on the curled toe, dark green tights, a hat with a similar curve to the toe, two plastic ear points and a tunic that seemed to be on loan from Peter Pan. Yet this costume...
The price tag says "CLEARANCE! $75," you check your wallet, $24.31. You've never done anything like this before, but for some unexplainable reason you have to have this costume. The surrounding environment doesn't exactly discourage such thoughts. The racks were stuffed and offered ideal cover, there weren't any cameras or even windows from that matter. Even its size demanded its theft.
You look around to make sure no one rounds the corner, reach out, and shove it quickly into your pocket, a perfect fit.

As you leave you nod to the old man at the counter who nods back in turn. Then, just as your about to leave he look back up at you.
"Why don't you try it one before you leave? See how it fits."
You rush to the door, its locked tight. The old man is looking very intently at you.
"I've been needing a new helper for quite some time now," he said, his voice growing deeper and louder, "they keep getting lost in the snow trying to escape. You think they'd learn wouldn't you? Well I guess I shall have to deal with it until they do. You wont try any of that will you?"
You tremble in fear as the now bearded old man steps towards you and can only watch as he pulls the costume out of your pocket and pushes it into your hands, "What are you going to do to me?"
"Oh," he said, "Well, you see, Im making you into one of my elf workers. Unfortunately, the costume only works when the victim, you, puts it on of his own free will. However, I have found a way around that! They can either be one of my elves, or one of my reindeer." He said as he withdrew a larger bag from his enormous red coat with a brown costume in it. "Oddly enough, no ones gone for the second option... well, there was the one. Anyway, the door is locked, theres no way out, so you'd best make your choice."

14511.content:
"Hi, im Nate, can I help you?" asked the store clerk, as he walked up to you.

"Oh, hi." this was the first time you noticed him. You turned around, expecting just a normal guy, but you saw what looked like a elf. He was tall and slender, chiseled facial features, and sharply pointed ears. "Wow! That's a really good costume! And yes, I can't decide which to choose."

"Thank you. I spent a long time making these "costumes"." the way he said "costumes" gave you the chills. "which ones?" Nate asked.

"I can't decide to go with a dwarf, or a ghoul. My parents would flip out if I got the ghoul, so I'm thinking dwarf."

"So get a dwarf costume. We actually have a few different models. You can be a dwarf Mage, or warrior."

"I've never really been into mages, so I'll go with a warrior."

"Alright, now we have two choices for the warrior. There is the fat, but strong, axe wielding dwarf with a bare chest and braided red beard. Or a slim grey haired dwarf with full armor and a sword. Just bring the one you want up to the counter."
14511.title: Dwarfiness

145111.content:
Grabbing the fat, strong one you head up to the front counter.

"That will be 12.99 please."

"Wow, killer price. Thank you"

You then walk out to your car and go home. When you get to your room you tear open the package in exitement to try on your new costume. "it must be one size fits all, or a infallible costume" you think. You were a very scrawny guy. Your friends called you skinny white kid. First you grab the trousers. They were a nice tan leathery materal. You slipped them on, and it fit surprisingly well. After that you grabbed the large black leather boots. They fit surprisingly well also. Next came the belt. It reminded you of a almost animal hide version of batmans utility belt. Next you moved to the chest. It was pretty much just a blue cape, with a sling and bag. The sling held fake plastic vials and various small weapons. And finally the beard and hair. It was a red color, and had a long braided beard, with long red hair that curled a little at the bottom. Picking up the axe, you took one step. A sudden intense pain shot through your whole body. It was like thousands of firery needles were stabbing you everywhere. And then, it all went black.

When you finally woke up, you were laying in your room. You felt drool in your beard. And a nice, cool breeze blow over you belly. Wait...beard? Belly? You try to get up, finding it alot harder. When you finally get up, everything seems so much taller. You waddle/run over to your mirror and look at yourself with excitement/horror. You never really liked how your body was, but this was crazy.

You were about 4 feet tall, with a big belly. There was red hair coming from your chest. Your beard was long and braided. You looked exactly like the picture! Your face had even changed. It was fatter, with rosy cheeks, a big nose, and smallish eyes. You were a dwarf.

Home alone you go to your bedroom door, open it and find...
145111.title: The fat strong one

1451111.content:
You anxiously head to the bedroom door, hoping you can go out and find someone who can help, only to open it and find yourself staring out into a lush forest, to your confusion.

Something else had changed, and now there was a forest where the rest of your house should. Though, for some reason, you have a strange feeling that isn’t the case. As you look behind you, you’re shocked to find the inside of your house has changed as well, becoming a small cottage.

“What the hell…?” You mutter, noting that your voice has sounds much more gravellier. You absentmindedly stroke your beard, as if it’s natural for you to do so as you look around at your house and see how much it’s changed. There’s a well-stocked kitchen, which, considering your belly, makes a great deal of sense. You’re feeling hungry just thinking about it.

You turn back to the forest outside and consider trying to find someone who can explain what’s going on…
1451111.title: Outside World

1452.content:
You would've expected an isle full of ghost costumes to be boring, right? Wrong.
Instead of just plain white sheets, the racks were filled with bright neon outfits and necklaces that looked like 60's stuff. Each one had a different symbol on them, like Chinese or something. There were hangers with real night-vision goggles and some kind of glove that looked like the stuff you make magnets with.
Amazed, I walked slowly down the isle, picking up a pair of night-vision goggles and a pair of gloves. Then I walked over to the brightly colored jumpsuits. An eye-catching green one caught my eye, and I took it off the rack, holding it with one arm as I walked a little more down the isle. Next came the necklaces. They were made of thick, glass gold and silver beads, with blood red string to hold it all together. As I took one, I wondered how all this could possibly be a ghost costume.
I walked back to the man at the front desk. He was sitting behind it, reading a fashion magazine. I asked him if I could try the stuff on.
"Sure," he said. "Changing rooms over there," he pointed to the back of the shop.
Still slightly stunned by all the brightness, I walked to the back where he'd pointed and opened the changing room door. When I was inside, I slid the lock in, then started trying the stuff on.
I started with the jumpsuit. It was difficult getting into it, since I was so used to the normal shorts and T-shirt outfit, but I managed. After I pulled my sneakers back on, I pulled the night-vision goggles over my head. It was like tunnel vision, and I didn't see how these things would help me see in the dark, but I just shrugged and started pulling on the magnet-like gloves.
1452.title: The ghost costume

1511221.content:
You saw your friend, Tiffany in the parking lot. She was tall, with a slender body, blond hair, and blue eyes. You called to her and she spotted you after looking about a moment. At first, she did not recognize you but then you did not expect her to. "Hi, are you new to the school?" she asked, kindly. "I see you made it on the squad, congratulations."

You giggled. "Actually, It's me, Jake." you said. "I went to the new costume store and picked out this cheer leading uniform..."

You then quickly explained the events, including your secret desire to be a girl. You did not expect Tiffany to believe your story but, to your surprise, she hugged you, giggling.

"Why didn't you tell me!?" she asked, releasing you. "I would have taken you to my grandfather's shop a long time ago!"

"Your grandfather owns that store!?" you asked with a giggle.

Tiffany smiled, laughing. "You see, he's a warlock who specializes in transformations, only he believed in enhancing lives, not ruining them." she explained. "If you ever get tired of being a girl, just go back and ask for a reversal. He will give you your old clothing back, which will change you back to normal upon putting them on."

"How long do I have to decide?" you asked. "I'm sure your grandfather is not going to hold everyone's clothing forever."

Tiffany thought a moment. "You have one month to decide." she replied. "After that, get used to skirts and dresses."

"This is great!" you said, giggling. "I'm going to explore everything this form has to offer."

"Careful what you wish for... Jessica." teased Tiffany. "There is more to being a girl than you might think."

You smiled. "Would you mind being my guide to womanhood?" you asked.

Tiffany laughed. "You have no idea what you are getting yourself into." she said, shaking her head. "But, since you are so curious, I'll help you."

She took your arm and escorted you to her mom's car. "Your journey will begin with a new costume for the party."

"I already have a costume." you protested.

Tiffany laughed again. "You have the school's cheer uniform, so unimaginative." she said. "No, my new best friend will be wearing..."

1513121.content:
You claw with your blood-red but typist-length girl fingernails at where the slit in the girl skin had ended -- and squeal girlishly with the pain before you quickly give up. You look in the mirror: no welts under the pale makeup on your newly delicate neck, not yet, but you're sure there will be. But there's no sign of that slit that allowed you to get into the fake girl skin...

Okay, the impossible has happened. That girl skin is now your real, live skin and what was your body is now the body inside that skin. Physically you're now an adorably pretty young woman, surely no older than twenty, who's dyed her light brown hair (except at her crotch) black, painted her nails blood-red and her lips to match, applied pale makeup to her face and neck, darkened her eyelids and the area around her eyes for a bit of a skull look. Probably she's been wearing industrial-strength sunscreen to keep her slender arms and slightly short but shapely legs pale. Your guy clothes are way, way too big for who you've become: you're tiny even for a girl your age, maybe five feet tall. Cute little freckles show through your makeup on and near your little snub nose, undercutting the whole Goth look and making you look approachable, even cuddlesome. Why can't the scrumptious, tiny girl in the mirror be your girlfriend, with or without the Goth shtick? Why does she have to be you? It's not fair!

You sigh like an exasperated girl -- it, and the expression on your pretty face when you do it, would be cute and sexy if they weren't your sigh and your expression -- and start to get dressed in the clothes that make up the rest of the Goth Girl costume. You don't want to be naked and your old clothes really are out of the question unless you wear your guy shirt as a sort of crude short dress -- forget that. You put the costume clothes on as if you've always been a girl: black bra, black panties, black sleeveless blouse that bares your trim and pale midriff, black knee-length stockings, short black pleather skirt, spike-heeled black shoes... you decide to go all the way and add the jewelry that's part of the costume: spider-shaped earrings, a necklace with a heavily tarnished silver locket you don't bother to look inside, a black snake-eating-its-own-tail bangle for each wrist. You look at the result in the mirror. You're adorable, too cute to be scary, Goth enough to be oddly sexy -- though you suspect you'd clean up well into an ordinary pretty girl.

Now you're -- the girl in the mirror is you, no denying it -- ready to leave the dressing room. Surely there's someone in the shop who can explain your metamorphosis. You go through the pockets of your guy clothes to get your wallet and keys before you leave.

You’re a little disoriented but it doesn’t take long for you to find the counter with the cash register next to where you entered the shop. Instead of the old man who welcomed you, there’s a cute short woman with a mischievous young face, her white hair in a pixie cut, wearing a sort of uniform with a long skirt. “May I help you, Miss?” she asks you.

“I put on one of the costumes and now I’m not myself!” you blurt out. “And my driver’s license changed to match my body!”

“Well, that’s rather the point of this establishment,” says the shopgirl. “Sometimes it takes a few minutes to get the memories to go with your new identity. Also, ID cards and suchlike usually change promptly, but your old clothes might take longer to match your new body.” She’s not smug, just matter-of-fact about it all.

“I don’t want to be a Goth girl and my name isn’t Ashley Freeton!” you say, finding to your surprise that you’re not angry.

“The magic spells that control this shop ensure that you wouldn’t have even entered if you didn’t want to become someone else,” says the cute woman, sounding a bit pedantic but pleasant. “They also ensure that you choose and put on the proper costume to provide a new identity in which you’ll be happier and live a more-fulfilling life. In that life, you’re a beautiful young woman named Ashley Freeton who a present dresses as a Goth girl. Just give reality a few minutes to catch up.”

You’re about to complain further.

"It was a Goth Girl costume," says Lisabeth, "but not just Goth makeup and Goth clothes, but a Goth girl's skin, and you put on the skin and it made you into Amy Grubek the Goth girl."

"Yes!" You're immensely relieved that your impossible situation doesn't seem impossible to someone else. "Except I'm my usual self in Amy's body! And I don't think I can be Amy... and I don't think I want to be Amy..." You're about to cry.

"Everything's going to be okay," says Lisabeth, and somehow you feel that it will be. "Just do this. Gather up your old body's clothes, leave the dressing room, go to the checkout counter, pay for the Goth Girl costume that's so wonderful that you can't bear to take it off, get a shopping bag for the clothes, and leave. There's a nice espresso bar across the street. Order something and wait there -- one of us will come and get you as soon as we can, maybe half an hour. I'm at work and I'm not sure I can get away... it'll probably be Cassandra... one of us will call if we're delayed, and call me again if you need to. Okay?"
1513121221.title: "Here's what you have to do."

choices: You just pay up and leave.
15131212211.content:
You tell Lisabeth you'll do as she says, thank her, and hang up. Your neck hurts where you tried to tear off your skin, and when you look in the mirror, ugly red welts shine through the pale makeup on your neck. There's a little makeup compact among the stuff you dumped from your Amy purse, and you get it and apply makeup over the welts, which hurts a bit but makes them less glaringly obvious. You seem at home using makeup now, but it's already obvious that you're now Amy Grubek in more than just body, even if you remember being only your guy self.

You bundle up the clothes you had as a guy, wrapping the jeans around the shoes. You put back in Amy's purse the things you dumped out, and, purse hanging from your left wrist, you open the dressing room door, pick up the bundle of your former body's clothes -- will you ever wear them again? -- and head out. Soon you're at the checkout counter. The very attractive fortyish woman looks puzzled for a moment, then says, "Oh, you're wearing the costume you're buying! I thought you were a real Goth girl!"

You're tempted to tell her what happened to you, but she seems to be just a clueless employee who has no idea that any costume in this shop might transform a tall man into a short woman. Or maybe she's an evil magic-wielding mastermind masquerading flawlessly, perhaps in a costume like the one that gave you your Amy Grubek body, re-made into a lovely bleached-blonde not-too-bright MILF, just to watch hapless customers leave this place transformed permanently, secretly gloating -- but if so, what can you do? "Oh, I think I left the tag in the dressing room..." is all you say.

"Oh, never mind getting it, it's in the register's computer," she says. "Ultra-Deluxe Goth Girl by Re-Embodiments. Oh, and it's on sale! Top of the line, but only a hundred ninety-nine dollars before tax -- that's an incredible bargain! I love these costumes -- you just put them on and you just, you know, ARE whoever the costume is of! No wonder you didn't take it off! I wouldn't have."

You're convinced that she knows more than you'd thought. Maybe she's who she is thanks to an Ultra-Deluxe MILF by Re-Embodiments, say, rather than an old hag. Should you just pay up and go away quietly, or should you make a fuss to this smug, chattering woman about being transformed by and stuck in your costume? You remember what Lisabeth told you to do, but...
15131212211.title: Do exactly as she says.

choices: Amy's phone rings and you answer.
151312122111.content:
You suspect that this MILF of a shop clerk knows perfectly well that you have been transformed, physically and perhaps to a degree mentally, from a tall young guy into the tiny Goth girl you are now, that the transformation is against your will and seems to you to be irreversible, and that what she said about the costume that caused the transformation amounts to gloating over your situation. You suspect that the shape she wears isn't her proper one, either. You do exactly as Lisabeth told you over the phone: you pay up, get a shopping bag to hold the clothes you wore as a guy (the clerk sees the clothes, and surely realizes that they're way, way too big for you now, yet despite her earlier chattiness says nothing about that), and leave.

As a guy you weren't too fond of espresso or espresso drinks, but you can smell them from across the street, and the thought of a latte is very attractive just now. You step a few paces away from the door to the costume shop, take your Amy wallet from your Amy purse, and see if there's money in it. You had a little under a hundred dollars in your wallet when you were you, and this wallet seems to have the same amount in it. You cross the street, purse over your left wrist, the handles of the shopping bag in your right hand, and enter the espresso bar. It's not too busy. The barista is a tall guy -- though shorter than you were before you entered that costume shop, and maybe it's just that everyone else looks tall to you now that you're five feet nothing -- who affects a bit of a Goth look himself and looks at you with complete approval. You order and pay for a medium latte but he makes it a tall one and throws in a couple of little biscotti for free, and you tip him generously. You get the impression he'd like to ask you out, but senses perhaps that you've been hurt and need to be left alone for now. Hurt... if he only knew...

The latte is the best you've ever had -- or it's merely a good latte and your new Amy Grubek body likes lattes. You're not sure which. You nurse your drink and nibble your biscotti. As your usual self you might have dunked them in your drink, but as Amy you don't feel like doing that. But if you're Amy, why aren't you more like Amy? Not that you exactly want to lose your original identity...

About half an hour later,
151312122111.title: You just pay up and leave.

choices: "You need to be Amy for now."
1513121221112.content:
She's about average height, slightly pudgy but shapely, maybe forty, with a big head of wildly frizzy natural-blonde hair, and she looks around the shop through her thick-lensed, rather droll eyeglasses. She wears a blouse and slacks and doesn't have a trace of Goth to her. And you recognize her as Cassandra, even though you're sure you've never met her before. "Over here, Cassandra!" you call out, and she hears you, catches sight of you, and heads for you. "Oh, there you are, Amy!"

"I'm not myself, Cassandra," you say.

"Yes, Lisabeth explained," says Cassandra. "Yet you recognized me, even though you'd swear you've never met me before."

"Yes," you say.

She orders a latte to go, and when it arrives, you both leave and walk half a block to her car, a little red Honda maybe ten years old. Once you're both buckled in and she pulls away from the curve, she says, "And now you'd like to know what's going on, Amy."

"Except I'm not Amy," you say. "Okay, I guess my body must be an Amy body, but..."

"You're certain you were someone else, a young man, just an hour or so ago," says Cassandra.

"Yes," you say.

"And you were," says Cassandra. "Except... oh, Lisabeth could explain this better..."

I'm sure you have a complete set of memories of being the guy you were a few hours ago, exactly like those you'd have if you'd been born that guy, grown up as that guy, everything."

Cassandra says,
15131212211121.title: "You used to be Amy."

The woman's patient with you -- too patient, it seems in retrospect, as if she's carefully and correctly handling a madwoman. You tell her that the Goth Girl costume has transformed your body radically, and show her your bundled-up clothes -- only when you do, you find that they've become girl clothes perfectly suited to your new body! Your shirt's become a frilly blouse, there's a slightly worn white bra that looks to be in your size, your briefs are skimpy white panties, your jeans are the right size for the tiny woman you now are, your running shoes are cute little pink girl-sneakers! There's even a purse with an empty wallet, presumably your usual purse and wallet, both not quite new.

When you complain about your hair, she pulls it off your head -- or, rather, pulls off the black, top-quality, hand-knotted all-human-hair Goth Girl wig you were certain you weren't wearing, revealing the lovely light-brown hair of the Amy Grubek of your driver's license photo...

There's no evidence that you're not a short, unusually pretty girl-woman named Amy Grubek who came into this shop and simply put on a high-quality but decidedly non-magical Goth Girl costume and some of the makeup that came with it.

"I want to see your boss, the owner of this shop!" you tell the woman.

"So, you admit it!" you say to the woman, triumphant.

"I might as well," she says, and bursts into tears. Her sorrow seems deep and genuine. "What's the use? I'm stuck as a wife and mother now, and you're stuck as pretty little Amy Grubek, and I'm sorry, I'm so sorry it had to happen to both of us, but it's... NECESSARY that we both lose our true bodies and become the women we are now. I should have been strong and closed the shop or told you to get the hell out rather than welcoming you in!"

"So you were that old bearded guy who looked like a stereotypical wizard..." you say.

"Yes," she says, "and now I'm Diane Malvern, married to the same man for twelve years, mother of three little girls -- so that my husband won't weep for his missing wife and my girls won't wonder why Mommy isn't coming home! The original Diane simply popped out of the universe and someone had to take her place, so a Diane suit appeared and I had to put it on and become her! Not only for my husband and my girls, but for the whole structure of reality to hold..."

"But what right did you have to let me in and let me get forced into being Amy Grubek?" you ask.

"None whatever," she says, and starts crying again. "I'm so sorry. Amy's coven needs her! Reality will fall apart if they don't do the right spells at the right time, and she's essential! SOMEONE has to be her, and... I'm so sorry it ended up being you! I wish it had been some lonesome old lady who would have loved turning into a cute young woman... but I wasn't strong enough to resist the pressures to patch up reality and let someone in RIGHT AWAY to become the new Amy..."
15131212211221.title: "But you are now," she says.

151312122112212.content:
"I must be the biggest sucker who ever lived," you say, wonder why you're using an odd, out-of-fashion word like "sucker," "but I believe you," you say to Diane.

"Go meet with Amy's coven," she tells you. "They need you to be Amy! If they act today, maybe not too many more people will have to lose their identities and have to take over for vitally important people like Diane Malvern or Amy Grubek who have to keep existing! Maybe the order of existence will even be patched up -- but almost anything they do with your help will be of some use, I know it. As the woman I am now, I can't really help. It's female magic, not the male wizard stuff I knew as a man, and as Diane I'm pretty much useless. The original Diane was not a magical woman -- consciously."

"What's so important about Diane that you had to lose your real body and identity and be transformed into her?" you ask Diane.

"I have no clue, Amy," she says, and sees you wince at being addressed as Amy. "Sorry, but a lot of people are going to be calling you Amy now. I'm afraid that it's your name now. Anyway, I don't know why it's so vital that there needs to be a Diane Malvern in the world and totally unimportant that Merlin Ambrosius Carter -- the man who I was, not two hours ago -- continue to exist, but I... I just know! I hope I get enough memories to know how to be Diane for her -- MY -- husband and kids, though. And it would help to be a heterosexual woman, too... just now I find you far more attractive than I'd find my husband."

"More than I need to know," you say.

You let Diane ring up the full sale price, plus tax, for the Goth Girl costume on your transformed credit card, and you sign it with a perfect Amy Grubek signature.

Diane gives you a hug and wishes you goodbye and good luck.

1513122.title: Get dressed in the rest of the costume.

Your shoes had become high-heeled platform boots without you even noticing. However, the biggest thing was your new horns and tail. Clearly, you knew what ring had done. It had made you into some kind of devil or succubus. "But I don't feel evil. That's good." You sigh. Apparently these costumes only make you look like things, not actually turn you into them... "Well, then, maybe I should get this ring off..." You try to slip the ring off, but find it had vanished!! "What the...?"

Why don't you try and pick up your dirty clothes after you shower like a normal person!!" She throws an assortment of suggestive goth clothes at you, smacking you in the face with them.

151312221.content:
You stand still, facing your car, and tremble a bit as wave after wave of new memories rush into your feminine little head. Meanwhile there’s the distraction of seeing your beaten-up old car transform into a late-model pink Mini Cooper Countryman.

If anyone else has seen your car change, they must not care. Your new memories include buying it. You’re a graphics nerd girl, very well paid, named Amy Grubek, who for a few years has gone for a Goth look but is slowly getting tired of it. You have a doting boyfriend who says he likes it, but you suspect he prefers your cute face without makeup and would find it a turn-on if you let your hair grow out to its natural brown.

Your old memories are intact but set aside, and seem to be of things that happened to someone else. You realize that being Amy is a total win, and your new straight-girl body and self are much better than the ones you had! Being a cute woman with a career and a boyfriend you love — if it didn’t seem so natural to you now, you’d literally dance for joy!

You’re completely happy with your situation. You
151312221.title: you’re a girl. A particular girl, your new self.

1513122212.content:
You go back into the costume shop. “Good to see you again, Amy,” says the person at the counter. It’s not the wizardly-looking old man, but an adorkable little redhead girl-woman in outsized glasses, the lenses obviously thick and functional.

“Have we met?” you ask the girl.

“Well, as other people,” she says. She goes over to the door of a small closet and takes out a hanger with a combined skin-and-clothes costume that’s recognizably the old man who welcomed you into the shop! “Got tired of being him, so I thought I’d be me instead. Less of a wizardly ambience to the shop, but a cute shopgirl has her own appeal. So how do you like being Amy Grubek?” She puts the wizard costume away.

“It seems, well, great!” you almost squeal in delight. “But is it real? Am I really Amy? Is she, am I, a real woman with her, my, great job and great boyfriend and everything?”

“You’re real now,” says the redhead. “And the boy you were exists only in your memories. Nobody will miss him.”

“I thought this was just a costume shop,” you say. “You’re selling whole new lives?”

“Mostly it’s a costume shop,” she says. “But some people are simply better off being someone else, and... didn’t it just seem natural to get into the goth girl suit and become you?”

“Entirely,” you say. “I wasn’t even looking for a girl costume, let alone... okay, okay, I admit I’d wondered if I’d have been happier as a girl...”

“And now you know!” She sounds contented but not smug. “Oh, I’m glad you came back and didn’t just drive off into your new life, Amy.”

“How much do I owe you for my goth girl costume — or do I mean my goth girl self?” you ask her.

“Strictly speaking, nothing,” she says. “The boy and the girl costume don’t exist now! But given your personality, I think you’ll feel better if I put a charge on your credit card.”

You reach into your purse and unerringly remove your blood-red leather wallet and take out what you now know to be your usual credit card. The shopgirl uses a card reader and soon hands you back your card, a cheap ballpoint pen, and a $250 receipt to sign. “That little?” you ask. “For a whole new life?”

“It’s enough,” she says, and without thinking you produce the signature “Amelia Anne Grubek” in elegant and very feminine writing that you know you perfected back in high school — as Amy!

You give the redhead a big hug, and it feels so right that you’re not sexually attracted to her shapely little body — well, now that you’re Amy, you’re actually a bit smaller than she is! You say your goodbyes.
1513122212.title: Go back to the shop to pay and say thank you.

15131222121.content:
With a final thank-you to the cute nerd girl minding the costume shop, you go to your car as if it’s always been the pink Mini Cooper you bought and you’ve always been Amy Grubek. You clearly remember your former self, younger and male and less intelligent, and delight in how different you have become, in being a cute short woman excellent at a job she loves, in love with her exemplary boyfriend. Your former self would have found your Amy body very attractive, which just adds a little extra delight at it being yours. Rather be the cute girl than never get her, you think.

Just as you’re about to get into your car, your phone rings in your purse. It’s a recent iPhone, not the barely-a-smartphone the old you had. You find it promptly and answer the call: it’s your boyfriend. “Tyler! Is our date still on for tomorrow?” you say.

“Of course, Amelia Anne,” he says. Everyone else calls you Amy, but your given names roll off his tongue beautifully and you love to hear him say them. (You also hated your boy name and Amy is already a great improvement.) “Wish it were tonight as well.”

The two of you talk as you drive home — to your very nice apartment, not where you lived as a boy, another improvement due to Amy-hood. You’re both good at flirting, and your Amy brain gives you a quick wit you never had as a boy, and you hear Tyler’s rather sexy laugh more than once. When Tyler has to end the call, you say, “I’ll have a surprise for you tomorrow, Ty!”

“I’ll look forward to it, Amelia Anne,” he says, and you say your goodbyes.

You go home and start working: you want to have tomorrow free to prepare your surprise for Tyler. At dinner time you microwave a few frozen things and eat them at your computer, and it’s almost midnight when you realize you’ve gotten more done than you had to.

The next day you wake fairly early. After a quick breakfast you start working on your surprise for Tyler: de-Gothing yourself. Soon your fingernails have clear polish rather than blood-red. You take stock of your clothes and see what you need to shop for. You decide to leave your dyed-black hair and eyebrows and eyelashes alone.

The wig shop near the local hospital (catering largely to chemotherapy patients) has a sign out, advertising a sale, and you go inside on a whim and score a wig on closeout in roughly your natural hair color and in a reasonable style. You go to a few thrift shops as well, and find some very not-gothic clothes in your small size. It’s so right, being Amy and knowing how to do all this!

When you open your apartment’s door to Tyler’s knock around 5:30, your dyed-black eyebrows and eyelashes are the only things visible of your usual Goth Girl appearance. Your brown wig isn’t obviously a wig, you’re wearing no obvious makeup and every cute freckle on your face shows, you’re in a high-cut long flowery dress with long sleeves, and you’re wearing cream-colored pumps with two-inch heels.

Tyler sees you and he’s
15131222121.title: You leave.

You picked up the maid costume and smiled. "This will bring a few laughs at the mansion party." into an empty changing room, you said. "Maybe I can even help the real maids, earning some points."

The costume consisted of a black sleeveless dress with black leggings underneath, a white apron over it, a green bow around the collar and a white hair piece to top it all off. It was certainly a strange maid costume but it was the same uniform the maids in the mansion wore except they wore white stockings. You disrobed down to your underwear and donned the uniform. Once you had finished closing the zipper in the back, you looked in the mirror and smiled. "I like it." giggling, you said. "I'm sure to be turning heads at the party."

Then you felt something strange, it was as if someone had lit a match, your entire body felt as if your entire body was suddenly on fire. You grunted then screamed as the burning became more intense. That was when it happened; your muscles exploded, swelling to massive proportions as you quickly grew in height! "What's happening to me!?!" your voice dropping, you demanded.

Turning to the mirror, you saw that your teeth were changing shape, becoming sharp, canine like, as your hair turned black and grew down to almost mid back length while your muscles, your entire body continued to expand to inhuman proportions. When it was finally all over, you looked at the mirror in shock. You had become a massive six and a half foot muscular giant of a man in a maid's uniform! As you stared at this frightful new image, something clicked in your mind. "Wait, I know this character." your voice booming, you said. "I've become the amazing and fearsome Kogarashi, the masked Maid Guy!"

You laughed, your voice shaking the room. "This is better than I have ever imagined!" amused, you said. "This costume is sure to not only win first prize but maybe score me a job at the mansion!"

Happy with your purchase, you paid for the costume and walked out. Only, as you left, the elderly store owner said, "Be sure to come back within seven days, if you want your old life back! Otherwise, this is will be your new true form!"

15133222121211121.content:
You sit on the bus and feel odd, surprisingly not because of people staring at you, but because people weren't staring at you, like a cat-tailed girl was perfectly normal. "What is with these people?" you wonder. About two blocks from the bookstore, you decide you can't take the lack of stares anymore and try to figure out what is going on. "Maybe if I draw attention to it..." You stand up and begin swishing your tail in another girl's face. She sneezes from the fur tickling her nose, then grabs the appendage, and pushes it down, shouting, "Would you please get your tail out of my face, ma'am? It's bothering my sinuses!!" Annoyed by how blase she acted about your tail, you were about to yell at her and ask why she didn't find your tail the least bit out of place, when the bus stopped at your destination, the bookstore.

"Maybe I can wrangle some clues from my friends!!" you think, holding your fist up as you make your way out. The girl you swished your tail in front of said to another woman, "What was her problem?"

"I don't know. She acts like we've never seen a girl with a tail before."

In the bookstore, you quickly find your friends in your usual haunt in the store, a set of sofas and chairs around a coffee table outside the prerequisite coffee shop. "About time you got here, Megumi (you)!!" a boy said. He was not fat, but he also wasn't a portrait of health, either. His short red hair only accentuated his abundant freckles. It was Coby. With him was Kevin, Packard, Luke, and Rajita, who (until now) was the only girl in your group.

You look around, thinking there was some other girl around they never told you about named Megumi, but when he came over to you saying, "Haha, very funny!!" you realize reality itself must have changed, and now your name is Megumi, where it used to be Rick.

Packard, the resident expert of shojo manga, said, "Have you read the newest Sakura Hime yet?"

"Et tu?" you wonder, surprised they are saying nothing of the fact you are now sporting a tail, let alone a girl. Finally, you have to ask the question. "Guys, do you find it odd I have a tail?"

"No."

"No."

"Nope."

"Not at all."

Coby asks, "Actually, it seems more odd you'd ask a question like that. You never had a problem with your tail before..."

"Before...?" This swirls in your head. Did this blasted costume rewrite your entire life's history? "I'd just like to know, why do I have a tail?"

"Are you feeling alright?" Luke asked. "Did you hit your head or something?"

With all these eyes on you, but for the wrong reasons, you stumble into a lie. "Why, yes I did!! Hit it on the way here!! Think I might have a touch of the amnesia, that's all!! Now tell me why I have a tail."

"You should be in a hospital then." Rajita said.

"Yeah, yeah, in a minute. First, answer my question."

"If it'll get you to go get medical attention, I'll remind you... You were born with it, as were several other girls around the time you were born. Had something to do with a fragment from that comet that hit Jupiter ricocheting off Jupiter's atmosphere and hitting the Earth. Supposedly it had it had some mutagenic virus in it that affected only female embryoes. Now all girls born have a 1 in 4 chance of being born with a tail of a random animal species. At first, doctors considered amputation, but the tails would simply grow back in a matter of weeks, and for some reason, girls with intact tails seemed to begin showing signs of possessing superior physical capabilities, but seem to lose them when their tails were cut off. As a result of the combination of all these things, doctors simply stopped bothering to amputate, and now girls with tails are largely accepted. Even Rajita has a tail, or did you forget that too?" She stands up and reveals a dog's tail that looked like it belonged to a Labrador Retriever sticking out the seat of her skirt, the only reason you didn't notice it before was how she had it curled behind her in the couch cushions.

"Oh wow, I feel better now!! Thanks." You really didn't want to go to the hospital, especially to have to hear your parents chew you out for faking a major head injury (and running up a major medical bill).

However, your friends had a different plan. "Oh no. Go to hospital now." Coby said sternly, practically trying to drag you out of the store.

Finally, as you reach the store doors, you blurt out the truth, all of it... The costume shop, the magic catgirl maid costume, reality as it was before you donned the tail, what you did with the ears...


How do they react?



Elsewhere, the girl you waved your tail in front of was at her doorstep, drenched in sweat, sneezing profusely. "I knew I was allergic to cats, but I've never had an attack like this before..." Suddenly, she groans as she falls on her knees, dropping her keys, as a tabby striped cat tail ripped out the seat of her jeans. "This is... impossible..." she utters, looking back to see her tail, then she looks forward again when she hears footsteps. Her eyes were growing heavy, but she swore she saw a an auburn haired maid with cat ears standing over her, saying, "I'll make it all better, nya!!" The maid leans over and licked her ears as she passed out, and unbeknownst to her, her ears began to transform, beginning to match the shape of the maid's ears...

You didn’t have to check the cute little backpack you use as a purse: you know that your Hello Kitty wallet with your driver’s license and your grad-student ID with your name (Sophie Anne Masters: your initials have led to the rather androgynous nickname Sam, but you’re very feminine) and photo (looking adorkable with your nerd-girl glasses and your hair up) is in there. The only thing keeping you from literally jumping for joy is the sheer normality of your body and mind and self: you have to set aside the memories of being the nondescript teen boy you were, or the utter delight of being not that boy but a beautiful woman with a magnificent brain will overwhelm you.

Soon you’re back at the counter and the old man and the short, lively woman are there. Clearly they’ve been waiting for you. You look straight at the woman and say, “I don’t care how intelligent you’ve made me! I’m not going to clean the Augean stables of modern physics for you!”

She looks crestfallen. “Oh, well, it was worth a try.”

The old man says to her, “Nerissa, how many girl suits have you turned into Einstein-level nerdy cuties?”

“Just the one that made her out of that boy,” she said. “Actually more than Einstein level. I think that string theory is a dead end, and she’s the woman to go past it.” She looks at you sadly. “Or so I thought.”

“I’m not doing it for you,” you say. “I’m doing it for myself! And for Science!” you conclude in a thrilling voice thanks to yet one more gift of your transformed self, your new acting talent. Then you break into a beautiful, infectious laugh that the other two can’t help but join in.

They won’t accept your money. After hugs and chaste if enthusiastic kisses, you say your goodbyes and “return” to the University.

15133222222222121212.content:
You wake up nauseated, but it’s the fourth month of your first pregnancy and it’s usual. Jake is already up: you hear him in the kitchen. You get out of bed, put on your glasses, go to the bathroom, and hurriedly put up your long, thick hair, its warm brown now shot with pure white. You catch a glimpse of yourself in the mirror and you’re the same beautiful woman you’ve been for twelve years, only a well-preserved thirty (you and Jake rather like the white in your hair) instead of the girlish eighteen of the woman created from the highschool boy by the girlsuit. The smell of Jake’s excellent cooking proves too much, and you quickly remove your glasses, kneel by the toilet, and throw up. There wasn’t much in your stomach, and after a few more seconds of dry heaves it’s over. You get up, wipe your mouth on toilet paper, put on your glasses, rinse your mouth, go to the kitchen.

Jake has hot tea for you, or rather dried ginger root steeped in hot water. You accept it gratefully: you’re tired of it, but it does seem to help with the nausea. “Sorry to put you through this, Sam,” he says, as he’s often said.

“I want this kid as much as you do,” you say. Strangely, you’ve been off contraceptives for over two years, but you were able to get pregnant only when you and Jake had published your groundbreaking paper. The ideas were yours, but Jake’s genius for math had again and yet again proven vital, and you’re grateful for a husband who’s also your most important collaborator.

You find that after the ginger tea you can tolerate a two-egg omelet freshly prepared by Jake. As you eat, you think back over twelve years as yourself.

The big difficulties were with the science and the associated math — nothing else! You’ve led a charmed life, and often you wonder whether it’s literal magic that’s warded off sexual harassment (you’ve seen all too much of that directed against other young women), rather than respect for your extreme intelligence and awe for your beauty. Even the most entrenched of the string theorists have all along been giving you a fair hearing.
The oddly cute Jacob Park, Jewish like his chemist mother though otherwise taking more after his Korean mathematician father, showed up at just the right time to be your personal math wizard, friend, lover, husband.

You’re genuinely surprised when the phone rings and it’s someone from the Nobel committee, telling you and Jake that you’ve won the Physics prize. You were sure they’d wait until next year.
